Platform.Title: UCSF_Gross_Ecoli_v18.txt
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: PCR products for 4110 ORFs representing 95.8% of the Escherichia coli K12 MG1655 ORFs were prepared according to Richmond et al (1999; Nucleic Acids Res. 27:3821-35). The products were spotted onto glass slides to make DNA arrays as described in MGUIDE at http://cmgm.stanford.edu/pbrown/mguide/index.html and protocols on http://www.microarrays.org/
Platform.Description: A microarray with 6400 spot features. Tip configuration: Standard 16-tip steel pin Columns per Sector: 20 Rows per Sector: 20 Column spacing: 210 um Row spacing: 210 um

Column.Name: Block
Column.Description: Array spot block coordinate

Column.Name: Row
Column.Description: Array spot row coordinate

Column.Name: Column
Column.Description: Array spot column coordinate

Column.Name: 384 Plate
Column.Description: PCR plate identifier

Column.Name: Plate Row
Column.Description: PCR 384 well plate row

Column.Name: Plate Column
Column.Description: PCR 384 well plate column

Column.Name: NOMAD_ID
Column.Description: Unique ID on UCSF NOMAD database

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: Unique ID for gene represented by spot from NCBI (2004) for Escherichia coli K-12 MG1655

Column.Name: ORF_TYPE
Column.Description: Open Reading Frame Identifier

Column.Name: Name
Column.Description: Gene name represented by spot from NCBI (2004) for Escherichia coli K-12 MG1655

Column.Name: Description
Column.Description: Description of gene represented by spot from NCBI (2004) for Escherichia coli K-12 MG1655

Column.Name: FAILED
Column.Description: PCR fail (1) or success (0)

Sample.Title: EC18n177 RpoH 0 min Time course 1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: At OD450 = 0.3, cultures induced with 1 mM IPTG. Cells harvested 0 min after induction
Channel.Growth-Protocol: M9 minimal complete media, cultures grown aerobically at 30 degrees C in a gyratory water bath shaking at 240 rpm
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Culture samples for microarray analysis were added to ice-cold 5% water-saturated phenol in ethanol solution, centrifuged at 6,600 g and the cell pellets flash frozen in liquid N2 before storing at -80 degrees C until required. Total RNA was isolated from the stored cell pellets using the hot phenol method, and labeled Cy3 and Cy5 cDNA was prepared from 16 ug total RNA with 10 ug random hexamer (Integrated DNA Technologies, Inc., Coralville, IA, USA).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Indirect labeling method as described in Khodursky et al (2003; Methods Mol Biol 224:61-78)

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: At OD450 = 0.3, cultures induced with 1 mM IPTG. Cells harvested 0 min after induction
Channel.Growth-Protocol: M9 minimal complete media, cultures grown aerobically at 30 degrees C in a gyratory water bath shaking at 240 rpm
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Culture samples for microarray analysis were added to ice-cold 5% water-saturated phenol in ethanol solution, centrifuged at 6,600 g and the cell pellets flash frozen in liquid N2 before storing at -80 degrees C until required. Total RNA was isolated from the stored cell pellets using the hot phenol method, and labeled Cy3 and Cy5 cDNA was prepared from 16 ug total RNA with 10 ug random hexamer (Integrated DNA Technologies, Inc., Coralville, IA, USA).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Indirect labeling method as described in Khodursky et al (2003; Methods Mol Biol 224:61-78)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: cDNA from 16 ug total RNA, 15 ug poly(dI-dC), 3xSSC, 25 mM Hepes (pH7), 0.225% SDS. Samples hybridized on array under a lifterslip for 12 hrs at 65 degrees C
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides scanned using GenePix 4000B scanner (Axon). TIFF images analyzed using GENEPIX 3.0 software (Axon).
Sample.Description: Wild type vs RpoH (Sigma 32) 0 min after overexpression
Sample.Data-Processing: Data filtered for PCR success, >3x local background and spot quality (GenePix Flag). Normalized using Lowess smoothing from MA plot

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Spot R/G Expression ratio (log2-transformed and Lowess-normalized using a Lowess fit to a MA plot)

Column.Name: M
Column.Description: Spot R/G Expression ratio (unnormalized). M = log2 ((F635 Median - B635)/(F532 Median - B532))

Column.Name: A
Column.Description: Spot Intensity. A = log2 (sqrt(F635 Median - B635)*(F532 Median - B532))

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Culture samples for microarray analysis were added to ice-cold 5% water-saturated phenol in ethanol solution, centrifuged at 6,600 g and the cell pellets flash frozen in liquid N2 before storing at -80 degrees C until required. Total RNA was isolated from the stored cell pellets using the hot phenol method, and labeled Cy3 and Cy5 cDNA was prepared from 16 ug total RNA with 10 ug random hexamer (Integrated DNA Technologies, Inc., Coralville, IA, USA).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Indirect labeling method as described in Khodursky et al (2003; Methods Mol Biol 224:61-78)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: cDNA from 16 ug total RNA, 15 ug poly(dI-dC), 3xSSC, 25 mM Hepes (pH7), 0.225% SDS. Samples hybridized on array under a lifterslip for 12 hrs at 65 degrees C
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides scanned using GenePix 4000B scanner (Axon). TIFF images analyzed using GENEPIX 3.0 software (Axon).
Sample.Description: Wild type vs RpoH (Sigma 32) 0 min after overexpression
Sample.Data-Processing: Data filtered for PCR success, >3x local background and spot quality (GenePix Flag). Normalized using Lowess smoothing from MA plot

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Spot R/G Expression ratio (log2-transformed and Lowess-normalized using a Lowess fit to a MA plot)

Column.Name: M
Column.Description: Spot R/G Expression ratio (unnormalized). M = log2 ((F635 Median - B635)/(F532 Median - B532))

Column.Name: A
Column.Description: Spot Intensity. A = log2 (sqrt(F635 Median - B635)*(F532 Median - B532))

Series.Title: Time course analysis of genes regulated by E. coli sigma 32 (rpoH) after overexpression
Series.Summary: DNA microarray analysis of genes regulated by the alternative sigma factor, sigma 32 (rpoH). Sigma 32-dependent genes were initially identified by comparing a wild type (wt) E. coli K-12 strain that has a low level of sigma 32, with a strain over-expressing sigma 32 (following induction of rpoH from an inducible promoter by IPTG). We monitored changes in gene expression in 4 separate time-courses. Because sigma 32 is negatively regulated, its activity decreases 10 min after overexpression. Consequently, to identify genes regulated by sigma 32 we analyzed the expression data for 10 min after overexpression using SAM (Statistical Analysis of Microarrays). We identified 105 genes organized in 66 separate transcription units. This study is detailed in Nonaka et al 2006 (submitted). Keywords: time course
Series.Overall-Design: This series consists of 4 replicated time courses from separate biological samples. Each time course consists of a comparison between wild type E.coli MG1655 that has a low level of sigma 32, and an over-expressing sigma 32 strain following induction of rpoH from an inducible promoter by IPTG. Both strains were grown to mid log and then induced with IPTG and incubation resumed. Samples were removed for comparative microarray analysis immediately prior to induction, and at 2.5, 5, 10, and 20 min after induction. To correct for changes in growth state, control and over-expressed samples were always compared from the same time point. Note time course 4 only contains the 10 min samples.
